content: Malaysian and Singaporean soup **Pig's organ soup** ([simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 猪杂汤; [traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 豬雜湯; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *zhū zá tāng*; [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB): *ti-cha̍p-thng, tu-cha̍p-thng*) or *chheng-thng* (清湯), is a [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysia) and [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) soup that is made from pork [offal](/wiki/Offal). The dish is a clear soup, served with other optional side dishes as well as rice. Mainly popular in Malaysia and Singapore, an [Indonesian](/wiki/Indonesia) variation of the dish, called "song sui", which originated from the [Bangka Island](/wiki/Bangka_Island) and is popular among [Chinese Indonesians](/wiki/Chinese_Indonesians) in the island. ## Content and variations The broth is boiled from a mix of offal including liver, heart, intestines, kidney, stomach, [tongue](/wiki/Tongue#As_food), lungs, [pig blood curd](/wiki/Pig_blood_curd), as well as pork meat slices, strips of salted vegetables, meatballs, minced garlic, pork bones, [celtuce](/wiki/Celtuce), [Chinese parsley](/wiki/Chinese_parsley) and a sprinkle of chopped onion leaves and white pepper. Side dishes include braised [tofu](/wiki/Tofu) puffs, and eggs and salted vegetables sometime are served. The meal is usually served with a special chili sauce or [soy sauce](/wiki/Soy_sauce) with chopped hot chili. - [Sekba](/wiki/Sekba) - [Pork blood soup](/wiki/Pork_blood_soup) - [List of Chinese soups](/wiki/List_of_Chinese_soups) - [List of soups](/wiki/List_of_soups) Portals: - Food - Singapore - Malaysia This [soup](/wiki/Soup)-related article is a stub.
